metadata.synopsis: Nayland Smith (Nigel Green) and helper Dr. Petrie (Howard Marion-Crawford) hunt diabolical Fu (Christopher Lee), out to rule the world with toxic gas.

reviews: Approaches everything with the utmost seriousness, which endows the hokey fantasy scenario with a certain gravity.
The ultra-sophisticate may find the broad melodramatic flourishes and the heroics unacceptable, but this isn't a film for the ultra-sophisticate.
Resourcefully directed and inventively scripted, The Face of Fu Manchu is a first-class thriller, weakened only by some rather summary characterisation, and a grandiose but flurried ending.
Christopher Lee is a trip playing the notorious Chinese villain Fu Manchu.
